sub_title: M.s. Health Education and Promotion; B.s. Public Health
summary: I am an aspiring public health researcher who enjoys connecting the dots: be it ideas from different disciplines, people from different teams, or applications from different industries. I have strong technical skills and an academic background in qualitative research, reproductive and sexual health, and public health education.

education.field_of_study: Alternative and Complementary Medicine and Medical Systems

profile_positions.description:
Conduct Interviews-
Responsibility for recruiting volunteers, as well as, scheduling interviews to be conducted both online and telephone with participants. During the interview, the research interviewer asks questions and records answers, asking follow-up questions to gather clear and usable data.

Data Analysis-
After conducting an interview, the research interviewer compiles data and prepares for analysis. These generally include information about the research participant, questions that the interviewer asked, and thematic coding of the participant’s responses. 

Maintain Participant Confidentiality-
Research interviewers are highly responsible for maintaining the privacy and confidentiality of research subjects throughout the research process. This includes presenting participants with privacy forms and following best practices while conducting interviews, compiling data, and preparing or submitting reports. Participants are also invited to ask questions related to privacy and confidentiality practices and procedures.

Present Findings to Supervisors-
In addition to conducting interviews and analyzing collected data, the researcher presents the results of interviews or findings directly to supervisors. In this aspect of the role, the research interviewer also needs to be prepared to discuss their interview process with supervisors and managers to help shape future interviews and writing process.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant Intern

profile_positions.description:
Worked on research into maternal and reproductive health by conducting a literary review on the experiences of Roma women in Europe. Prepared 15,000 words thesis entitled “Maternal Health Inequalities for Roma Women” and presented my research results to a panel of professors and other students.  
- Performed research on historical, political, and academic documents relating to information on the societal, cultural, and economic landscape of Roma women accessing maternal care within Europe.
- Regular presentation of findings directly to supervisor and peers. In addition to giving constructive feedback and support to help shape the future writing process.
profile_positions.title: Research Internship

profile_positions.description:
Customer service – The sales associate is often the customer’s first point of contact when they walk into the establishment. Associates greet customers and let them know they are available to answer their questions and help them find what they are looking for; while interacting with customers in a positive and friendly way. During downtime when there are few customers to assist, sales associates are expected to restock merchandise and keep the sales floor clean and organized. When customers are ready to make a purchase, the sales associate assists them at the checkout counter by ringing up purchases, process cash and credit card payments, and issue receipts.

Communication skills – Sales associates help customers see the value and benefit by assuring their shopping experience is pleasant and enjoyable. This involves answering questions, helping customers identify the products they want, and suggesting products the customer may not know they need. Being knowledgeable about a store’s merchandise is key to providing customers the information they need to make purchasing decisions. The sales associate is also required to communicate with employers and other employees in a clear and effective manner.

Interpersonal skills – The best sales associates are able to do little things that make a customer’s shopping experience memorable. This requires the ability to build a strong rapport with customers in a short amount of time, as well as enjoyment of helping people improve their wardrobe.
profile_positions.title: Sales Associate

profile_positions.description:
Organization – High organization skills are required, especially when sorting books via the Dewey decimal number or subject matter and preparing them for shelving. This part of the role requires a great deal of organization, as well as the ability to quickly alphabetize books or locate where they belong on the shelf using the library’s sorting system.

Customer Service – Additional responsibilities with helping patrons throughout the library by providing customer service. Such as, assisting patrons with locating library areas or resources, answering questions or make recommendations about specific titles or inform patrons of library events that might be of interest.

Multitasking – Flexibility is frequently required to provide administrative support to librarians, assistants, and technicians. Library pages are responsible for a variety of tasks around the library, so the ability to multitask, quickly switch between duties, and set priorities is also vital in this role.

Teamwork – Excellent team players and be willing to help out wherever they are needed most. High communication skills are required through phone or computer to get in touch with a specific library staff member, or locate them within the library and connect them with the patron.
profile_positions.title: Library Page
